body.p: TOWN CREEK Mr. and Mrs. Orley aims and fam- ily were Sunday callers at Nichols’. Mr. and Mrs. Ted Anderson and family called at Rex. Garvis’ Sunday. Mr. and Mrs. Anton Stenerson were at Ted Anderson’s Saturday evening. Warren Anderson was absent from school last week on account of illness. Mr. and Mrs. Orley Sims and fam- ily spent Saturday evening at Kerst- ing’s. Mr. and Mrs. W. Nichols and fam- ily were at W. Anderson's, Saturday evening. Mr. and Mrs. Arne Ameson were Saturday evening callers at A. Stener- son’s, a week ago. Mr. and Mrs. Ted Anderson and family have been recent Sunday visit- ors at Kersting’s. Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Stenerson were Sunday dinner guests at Arnold Ameson’s, at the Falls. Gladys Paulson and daughter spent Saturday and Sunday with her sister Mrs. Persons and family. Mr. and Mrs. Lyman Paulley, Ha- zel and Verna May called at the Er- nest Davis home, Sunday. Mr. and Mrs. Anton Stenerson at- tended the ski tournament at White- hall a week ago Sunday. Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Goldsmith and Vernon were entertained at the Dan Person home Thursday evening. Wm. Minder visiter her sister, Mrs. Wm. Nichols and family last week en- route to South Dakota from Janes- ville. Mr. and Mrs. Dan Persons, daugh- ter Agnes and their guests were last Sunday guests at Eunice Richard- son’s. Mrs. Will Onstad has been taking treatments for the removable of a foitre, expecting to be operated on uesday. Mr. and Mrs. Mike Gunderson and Frances, Mr. and Mrs. Osborne Gun- derson of Disco spent Sunday at Will Kersting’s. Mrs. Will Kersting had the misfor- tune to fall on a newly scrubbed floor Saturday, breaking the bone in the wrist of her left arm.
